titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Samuel McCallum Papers MC 118
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Norma Chaires.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-09-01T14:57-0400

did.abstract: Samuel McCallum was a student in the Medical Department at the University of the City of New-York (1878-1879). He received his diploma in 1879. This collection contains his diploma from the University of the City of New-York Medical Department and an autograph book dated 1878 to 1879 with autographs of his fellow students.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection is arranged into two series by topic. Within each series, there is one folder.

bioghist.head: Biography
bioghist.p: Samuel McCallum of New York was a student in the Medical Department at the University of the City of New-York (1878-1879). According to the "University of the City of New-York Medical Department Annual Announcement of Lecturers and Catalogue" (Session 1879-1880), he was under the instruction of Dr. W.F. Lindsay. He graduated in 1879 with a specialization in heart sounds. "The Announcement of Lecturers and Catalogue" also noted that the Medical Department graduate class of 1879 was the largest graduating class since the founding of the College in 1841.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Permission to publish materials must be obtained in writing from the:
New York University Archives Elmer Holmes Bobst Library 70 Washington Square South New York, NY 10012 Phone: (212) 998-2646 Fax: (212) 995-4225 E-mail: university.archives@library.nyu.edu

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Published citations should take the following form: Identification of item, date (if known); Samuel McCallum; MC 118; box number; folder number; New York University Archives, New York University Libraries.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection contains one diploma from the University of the City of New-York Medical Department, dated 1879, of Dr. Samuel McCallum, and an autograph book, dated 1878 to 1879, with the autographs of his fellow students.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Materials
separatedmaterial.p: Series II has been separated from the collection and stored in flat storage.
